title: It's easy being green: FEMAIL picks the best items for embracing autumn's most flattering hue
text:
She has selected items from the high street that will have you fitting in with trend

Hurrah! It’s time to dig out autumn’s most flattering hue — emerald.

With the chilly weather, it is inevitable that forest tones and teal shades will move to the front of your wardrobe. To say this isn’t a trend we have seen before would be a lie.

Yet, this year, there is one key difference: the colour isn’t relegated to one or two items.

The Duchess of Cambridge sparkles in a green Jenny Packham dress during her royal tour in Pakistan

The High Street is saturated with beautiful green knits, skirts, trousers and accessories. The choice is endless!

Heading to a party? Dazzle in a pair of metallic boots, teamed with a velvet blazer. Or, off to work? Add a splash of colour to your white shirt, by teaming it with a sage silk scarf.

Take it from us: this trend has the green light.

Fashion model Karlie Kloss wears a stunning green tartan dress by Dior teamed with a slick black belt

Block heel boots Marc Ellis at farfetch.com Shop

Camisole Cami NYC at theoutnet.com Shop
description: Emily Monckton has said as the chilly weather begins to set in, forest tones and teal shades will move to the front of your wardrobe this season.
authors: Emily Monckton For The Daily Mail
